variants.Description in input context: This missense variant leads to increased alpha-synuclein aggregation.
This variant alters phosphorylation sites in the protein.

Material used.Material Name: Drosophila melanogaster (Fly Model) expressing human SNCA
Material used.Description: The experiment utilized a transgenic Drosophila melanogaster line expressing human SNCA under a GAL4 driver.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunofluorescence staining revealed increased alpha-synuclein aggregation in neurons of flies expressing the c.228G>A variant compared to control flies.
Immunofluorescence staining showed altered phosphorylation patterns on alpha-synuclein in flies with the c.722A>T variant, compared to control lines.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent fly lines were used for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was imaged at least three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Flies expressing wild-type human SNCA served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Flies without SNCA expression served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used to analyze fluorescence intensity.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity below the 95th percentile of the control group is considered normal.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity above the 95th percentile of the control group is considered abnormal.

Material used.Description: The experiment utilized the SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cell line.

Readout description.Result Description: ELISA analysis showed increased alpha-synuclein aggregation in cells expressing the c.228G>A variant compared to control cells.
ELISA analysis showed altered phosphorylation of alpha-synuclein in cells expressing the c.722A>T variant compared to control cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells expressing wild-type human SNCA served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector cells served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to analyze protein levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein level below the 95th percentile of the control group is considered normal.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein level above the 95th percentile of the control group is considered abnormal.
